cab.content: Military Secret. 1120From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,16th October 1919.-(Received 18th.)1.4093. 16th October. Malleson wires 14th October :-"Merv. 6th October. Agent was sent to Knshk but no train went beyond Yulatan. At that place garrison about 25 men, mostly Sistani Baluchis, Latter told Agent ' it, as is commonly said, Afghans are coming to occupy Merv, we will all join them and turn against Bolshevics. Others would follow suit/" 2. In Merv on 6th October long train of wounded Bolshevics passed through towards Tashkent. There also arrived from Askabad 2 guns, 14 machine guns, and 200 Sarfc soldiers to strengthen Merv garrison which is quite small. This addition is doubtless due to the fear of Afghan aggression."
